Open your profile from the top-right, click Edit, update fields like name or avatar, then Save.
In your profile, choose Upload Avatar, pick an image file and save. File types like .png and .jpg work best.

input: how to create a group chat
output: From the Chats page click 'New Group', add members and a name, then click 'Create'.

input: how to add members to group
output: Open the group chat, click Members → Add member, then search and select users to add.
Open group settings and click 'Leave Group'. Confirm to remove yourself.
Hover over the message, click the three dots, then choose 'Delete' (if you have permission).
Socket.IO provides real-time, bi-directional communication between client and server — perfect for live chat.
Clients connect to the server via WebSockets (Socket.IO). When one user sends a message, server emits it to other participants instantly.

input: how to see who is online
output: Open the online users list in the sidebar — it shows users who are currently connected.
A read receipt indicates that the recipient has opened and viewed the message.
Go to Settings → Notifications and turn on desktop and/or push notifications.

input: why am i not receiving notifications
output: Check your browser permissions and notification settings in the app. Also make sure your device is online.
Click the attach/paperclip icon in chat, select an image, and send. Large files may take longer to upload.
Upload may fail due to size or network. Try reducing file size or uploading again. If it persists, check your connection.
Use the search bar at the top of the chat list — type keywords and hit Enter to find messages.

input: why is typing indicator not showing
output: Ensure you have internet connectivity and that typing indicators are enabled in Settings.

input: typing indicator is showing for me only
output: That may be due to delayed socket events. Try reconnecting or check server logs.

Open the message actions and select 'Pin to top' to highlight it for the group.

input: how to react to a message
output: Hover over a message and click the reaction emoji to add a quick reaction.
